meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dilatory.
meanings.sent1: Her dilatorinesses in completing tasks often caused frustration among her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The dilatorinesses of the government in responding to the crisis led to widespread criticism.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dilatorinesses, he always managed to finish his work on time.
meanings.sent4: The dilatorinesses of the snail in reaching the finish line amused the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The dilatorinesses of the sloth in moving through the trees made it seem like time stood still.

meanings.sent1: His dilatorinesses in making decisions often resulted in missed opportunities.
meanings.sent2: Procrastination is a common form of dilatorinesses among students.
meanings.sent3: The cat's dilatorinesses in catching the mouse turned into a game of patience.
meanings.sent4: The dilatorinesses of the river in reaching the ocean symbolized the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The dilatorinesses of the clouds in moving across the sky created a sense of tranquility.
